programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.sub-title: Smash Burger and Creamy Chicken with Mushrooms
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a midweek meal of speedy sweet pea chicken, a juicy Smash burger and a chicken and mushroom rice traybake. He batch-cooks his seven-veg sauce, followed by a spicy fish soup. And finishes off with a perfect pudding of tinned fruit granita.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a speedy midweek chicken traybake. He shows us cool ways to upgrade salmon, knocks up a shelf-raid quesadilla toastie, and transforms a batch-cook Bolognese into cheesy bread bowls. All finished off with a super simple banoffee tart.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.desc: Jamie shares a simple salmon dish perfect for a midweek meal, and some no-fuss fish cakes made from tins. He cooks a lamb Madras traybake, as well as a no-cook pasta sauce, and crowns it all off with a hot and crispy ice cream parcel!

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.sub-title: Smash Burger and Creamy Chicken with Mushrooms
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a midweek meal of speedy sweet pea chicken, a juicy Smash burger and a chicken and mushroom rice traybake. He batch-cooks his seven-veg sauce, followed by a spicy fish soup. And finishes off with a perfect pudding of tinned fruit granita.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast & Simple
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a speedy midweek chicken traybake. He shows us cool ways to upgrade salmon, knocks up a shelf-raid quesadilla toastie, and transforms a batch-cook Bolognese into cheesy bread bowls. All finished off with a super simple banoffee tart.

programme.title: Hardcore Carnivore
programme.desc: Jess heads to Wyatt Ranches in South Texas to check out the cattle ranching operation they've been running since 1965.

programme.title: Hardcore Carnivore
programme.desc: Jess visits Northstar Bison to learn about the small family-run ranch's breeding and processing operation, then prepares her signature smash burger.

programme.title: Hardcore Carnivore
programme.sub-title: Alpine Lamb Ribs from Siddoway Sheep Company
programme.desc: Jess joins the lamb-raising Siddoway family as they begin sorting the animals that are ready for processing. She then returns to the lodge, where she demonstrates how to prepare and grill lamb ribs.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Summertime seasonal fruit pampers your tastebuds. Chef Dale grills blistered grapes with ham wrapped Trout, Peaches with smoked Pork Chops, Watermelon with halloumi, and Chargrilled Cherries with chocolate Mousse.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde shows us how he does Sunday up right as he grills up some Vietnamese Brisket with Rice Noodles, Crispy Swordfish Summer Rolls, and tops it all off with some tasty Soju Floats. Hey, it's Sunday somewhere, right?

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde kicks the summer off right with a burger blowout featuring Brisket Burgers with Grilled Onions and Blue Cheese, Shrimp Burgers with XO Sauce and a Fried Egg, and Lamb Sliders with Feta Ranch and don't forget the Lemon Oregano Fries.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde tries his hand at hibachi by making supreme fried rice with shrimp, chicken, and bacon, pretzel pork dumplings, mushroom noodles, a filet of beef with the famous onion volcano, and washes it down with a melon & mint sake slushy.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.sub-title: Feast of Killer Crab & Perfect Pork Belly
programme.desc: Chef Dale Talde prepares a finger food feast with char grilled chili crab, spiced adobo potatoes, grilled pork belly, & sofrito stuffed branzino all served on a bed of rice over banana leaves. Call your friends - this is a feast that will feed many!

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: It's burger day! Chef Dale tackles three classics with a full flavor spin. Game changing Pho Burgers with bone marrow, toasted milk bread Ahi Tuna patty melts, and Chori Pan Burgers with a fried egg and shrimp chips.

programme.title: All Up In My Grill
programme.desc: It's Pizza Time! Chef Dale Talde grills up amazing pizzas for every palate including a Detroit Style Pie, a Cheddar Naan Pie with a Spiced Chick Peas & Potatoes, and gives your childhood favorite French Bread Pizza a much needed upgrade.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Cancel the pizza delivery, it's time to save money and build your pies from scratch. With three different pizza styles, you're bound to find one that satisfies your craving without digging into your wallet.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Prepping meals at home is cheaper and way more nutritious! Frankie makes portable breakfasts for the work week and forays into the stuffed dough of different cultures.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: From casual weeknights to special occasions, be the star of the dinnertime with these crowd-pleasing meals.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: You say hotdishes, Frankie says casserole. Either way, these one-pot hotdishes are an affordable way to feed a group of people, or the family for dinner. Plus they're great to freeze for future meals.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie prepares a Valentine's Day dinner for under $15 with a bistro-style theme to up the romance. Why go to a crowded restaurant for an overpriced prix-fixe menu with bad service when you can prepare a simple yet decadent romantic meal at home.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Versatility is important. These three items - bacon, eggs, and a whole chicken - will feed you a plethora of delicious meals... and for cheap!

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie takes us on a magical mushroom trip. They're packed with nutritional value and they're an affordable plant-based meat replacement. We'll learn about all things mushrooms and how to make some inventive, flavorful dishes.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Amp up your salad game with a little mixing and matching, from light and leafy greens to crisp and hearty toppings, and dressings for all occasions. Frankie shows us how versatile and fulfilling a homemade salad can truly be.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Eggplant: A fruit you didn't know was a fruit. Often underrated and overlooked, Frankie shows us how to shop for and cook this filling, delicious, cost-effective, and versatile ingredient. Master these cooking techniques.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Everyone knows Frankie can't live without pasta, but this week he shares his favorite Italian recipes that don't require any kneading. Add these simple, delicious dishes to your weeknight menu to complete your Italian dish repertoire.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Catching Gulf Coast Redfish and Blue Crabs
programme.desc: Pat visits Houston to go Gulf Bay fishing with chef Chris Shepherd, hoping to catch some redfish and gather a side of blue crabs.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: The Roscoe Family Legacy: Alabama Pit Ribs
programme.desc: Pat heads to Birmingham to team up with artist and chef Roscoe Hall, cooking ribs inspired by Roscoe's family legacy.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat travels to the Emerald Coast of Destin, Florida, to join his friend Adam Evans on a spearfishing adventure, sourcing fresh fish to cook over live fire.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat visits Edgar Victoria, known for bringing the street foods of Mexico City to Nashville, to do some live fire cooking out in nature as they prepare one of his favorite dishes - skirt steak tlayuda.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: The Legend of Louis Mueller's Dino Beef Ribs
programme.desc: Pat visits his close friend Wayne Mueller, third-generation pitmaster of Louis Mueller's BBQ, to learn the ins and outs of his famous dino beef ribs.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to a picturesque cattle farm in California's Santa Maria Valley, to hear firsthand from a young pitmaster who has uncovered the secrets of real Santa Maria barbecue.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Hickory Smoked Virginia Ham & Mint Juleps
programme.desc: Pat Martin gets a history lesson on the origin of American barbecue from "The Professor" Tuffy Stone.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Pit-Cooked Chicken with Alabama White Sauce
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to Decatur, Alabama to visit a storied institution of barbecue - Big Bob Gibson's. There, he learns the ins, the outs, and the history of a regional delicacy: pit-cooked chicken with Alabama white sauce.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: South Carolina Peach-Glazed Ribs with Rice Middlins
programme.desc: When Pat's friends and fellow barbecue chefs, Bryan Furman and Dr. Howard Conyers, come to town, the guys dig deep into the tricks and traditions of one of Bryan's specialties: pork ribs.

programme.title: Hardcore Carnivore
programme.sub-title: Alpine Lamb Ribs from Siddoway Sheep Company
programme.desc: Jess joins the lamb-raising Siddoway family as they begin sorting the animals that are ready for processing. She then returns to the lodge, where she demonstrates how to prepare and grill lamb ribs.

programme.title: Hardcore Carnivore
programme.desc: Jess visits Northstar Bison to learn about the small family-run ranch's breeding and processing operation, then prepares her signature smash burger.

programme.title: Hardcore Carnivore
programme.desc: Jess heads to Wyatt Ranches in South Texas to check out the cattle ranching operation they've been running since 1965.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern champions the often-overlooked mackerel with a main salad of pickled filets, charred tomatoes, grilled frisée, and sweet summer peaches. Then, he grills it whole seasoned with caramelized onions, rutabaga mash and charred grapes.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern reimagines the Hawaiian plate lunch with a hand chopped venison burger topped with homemade gravy and a fried egg, jumbo grilled shrimp, a humble macaroni salad and a heaping scoop of white rice.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: For pig roast perfection, Chef Andrew Zimmern marinates a whole hog.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Elk Tenderloin Tostadas and Grilled Rack of Ribs
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern highlights lean elk, first crafting classic Mexican tostadas with grilled tenderloin, avocado, and homemade salsa macha. Then, he grills a whole rack of elk, serving it with creamy colcannon, tarragon emulsion, and rosemary charcoal.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Poultry Perfection: Moroccan Spiced Guinea Hen with Charred Vegetables
programme.desc: Andrew unlocks the rich flavor of guinea hen with a vibrant grilled salad featuring watercress and a mustard-hazelnut vinaigrette. Then, he slow-roasts a whole bird with Middle Eastern spices, served with harissa squash and eggplant-tahini purée.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern prepares Carne Adovada.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Bison Tomahawk Chop with Italian-style Eggplant and Panzanella
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern shares a simple trick for getting the most out Bison tomahawk chops.
